intro: Hieracium protendens, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 60 to 120 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and it is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Hieracium protendens is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and has been classified as an invasive species in some regions.
